formalpara.title: MIPS new processor support
formalpara.para: GCC now supports the MIPS32R3, MIPS32R5, MIPS64R3, and MIPS64R5 processors. You can use the command line options -march=mips32r3, -march=mips32r5, -march=mips64r3, and -march=mips64r5 to enable code generation for these targets.

formalpara.title: Bug fix for incorrect code
formalpara.para: A bug that caused incorrect code to be generated when compiling with the -pg and -fuse-caller-save options has been fixed.

formalpara.title: New Position Indepedent Code multilibs
formalpara.para: Additional PIC runtimes have been added for ARMv7E Thumb-2 variants. For more information, refer to .

formalpara.title: Windows reserved filename bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that prevented the compiler and other tools from recognizing Microsoft Windows reserved filenames, such as NUL.

formalpara.title: Long path support on Windows hosts
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; on Microsoft Windows hosts now supports source and object files with paths longer than 259 characters. (These were already supported on GNU/Linux hosts.)

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error fix
formalpara.para: GCC now issues a diagnostic instead of crashing with an internal compiler error on code using register and asm to assign variables to registers that are reserved for special purposes (such as the program counter) or are otherwise unsuitable for the type of the variable.

formalpara.title: Instrumentation bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug that caused GCC to instrument functions tagged with __attribute__((no_instrument_function)) when compiling with -fprofile-arcs has been fixed.

formalpara.title: New 32-bit and 64-bit e6500 Power multilibs
formalpara.para: New multilibs that are compatible with the e6500 Power processor, and with 32-bit and 64-bit software respectively have been added. For more information, refer to .

formalpara.title: New ARMv7-A Thumb-2 little-endian VFPv3-D16 multilib
formalpara.para: A new multilib that is compatible with the ARMv7-A Thumb-2 architecture and the VFPv3-D16 hardware floating-point architecture has been added. For more information, refer to .

formalpara.title: Internal compiler error fix
formalpara.para: A bug in GCC has been fixed that sometimes caused internal compiler errors in var-tracking.c when compiling with optimization and debug information enabled.

formalpara.title: GCC ARMv6-M floating-point infinity subtraction bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug in GCC has been fixed that caused floating-point magnitude subtraction of infinities in code built for ARMv6-M to produce an infinity rather than a NaN.

formalpara.title: Branch optimization bug fix
formalpara.para: A bug has been fixed that caused GCC to unnecessarily emit long branch sequences instead of more compact PC-relative branches.

formalpara.title: GCC version 4.9.1
formalpara.para: &csl_prod; for &csl_target_name; is now based on GCC version 4.9.1. For more information about changes from GCC version 4.8 that was included in previous releases, see http://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.9/changes.html.
